spell.name: Devour Magic
entries: After casting this spell, you can take a reaction when you are the target of or in the area of a spell or magical effect that allows a saving throw. When you take the reaction, you have advantage on your saving throw. If you succeed on your saving throw, the spell or magical effect has no effect on you, and you regain a number of hit points equal to the spell's level.

spell.name: Ink Splash
entries: Ink shoots from your hand to a target. Make a ranged spell attack with the ink. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} poison damage and must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or become {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.
The spell's damage increases by {@damage 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d6}), 11th level ({@damage 3d6}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d6}).

spell.name: Blood Frenzy

components.m: a tooth from a {@creature devil shark|CCodex}

entries: You touch a willing creature. The target gains a keen sense of smell, granting it advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell. Additionally, the target has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hp.

The frenzy induced by the spell causes the target to lose the ability to discern between friend and foe. Each round, it has a {@chance 20|20%} chance to attack any adjacent living creature that doesn't have all its hp.
entriesHigherLevel: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature fo reach slot above 3rd.

spell.name: Alter Moon Phase
entries: You change the apparent moon phase for a 1-mile radius around you for the duration. If a creature within the affected area possesses abilities dependent on a particular moon phase, or change shape based on the moon phase, it must make a Wisdom saving throw to avoid being affected by this spell.

If you cast this spell at night, the altered moon phase can affect light. If you change the moon phase to full moon, light improves to dim light in the area. If you change the moon phase to anything other than full moon, light decreases to (or remains at) darkness. If you change the moon phase during the day, it has no appreciable effect on light.

spell.name: Moonbeam Form

time.condition: which you take when you take damage or are {@condition restrained}

entries: You become an incorporeal beam of pure moonlight for the duration. While in this form, you have immunity to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. While in this form, you can pass through openings at least 1 inch wide and through transparent objects. You also gain a flying speed of 90 feet for the duration.

spell.name: Tidal Manipulation
entries: This spell creates a gravitational effect similar to the moon's effect on tides. You can create your choice of low tide or high tides in an area up to a 1-mile radius from the point you designate. A low tide strands vessels and reduces flooding in the area, while a high tide might create flooding in an area. Vessels in a low tide are gently lowered to the seabed and take no damage.
You can use this spell to reduce the height of the wall created by the tsunami spell by 50 feet. This also reduces the damage dealt by the wall by {@damage 1d10}.

spell.name: Becalming Fog

components.m: a vial of condensation from a {@creature pact drake|CCodex|pact drake's} calming haze

entries: You create a 20-foot-radius sphere of fog centered on a point within range. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it. While a creature is in the fog and for 1 round afterward, it must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature cannot attack another creature. On a successful save, the creature is free to attack other creatures. A creature damaged by a weapon attack or a spell automatically succeeds on its saving throw.
entriesHigherLevel: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the duration is concentration, up to 10 minutes. If you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, wind cannot disperse the fog.

spell.name: Liquidity

components.m: a sponge and liquid from a {@creature venom elemental|CCodex} or {@creature water elemental}

entries: You transform a willing creature you touch, along with everything it's wearing and carrying, into a fluid form for the duration. The spell ends if the creature drops to 0 hit points.

While the target is in this form, its walking speed becomes 10 feet, and it gains a swimming speed of 40 feet. The target can enter and occupy the space of another creature. The target has resistance to nonmagical damage. The target can pass through small holes, narrow openings, and even mere cracks. The target can breathe water and air. The target's reach with melee weapon attacks increases by 5 feet.

While in fluid form, the target can only communicate in {@language primordial||Aquan}. It can manipulate objects, but any objects it was carrying or holding when the spell was cast can't be dropped, used, or otherwise interacted with. The target can't cast spells, and it has disadvantage with all weapon attacks except unarmed strikes. The target's unarmed strikes deal bludgeoning damage equal to 1 + its Strength modifier, regardless of any other abilities that modify this damage.

spell.name: Ember Burst

components.m: charred bark from a {@creature flame-scourged scion|CCodex}

entries: You create a momentary cloud of embers that engulf all creatures within 10 feet of you before disappearing. Each creature you choose within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 4d6} fire damage and become {@condition blinded} for 1 round. A creature that succeeds on its saving throw takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition blinded}.
entriesHigherLevel: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledice 4d6|2-9|1d6} for each slot level above 3rd. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the {@condition blinded} duration increases to 1 minute, and when you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the {@condition blinded} duration increases to 1 hour.

spell.name: Fulminar's Nimbus
entries: For the duration, bolts of lightning course around your body, shedding bright light in a 5- to 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of feet equal to the chosen radius. You can alter the radius as a bonus action.
In addition, whenever a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack, the creature receives a jolt from the lightning and takes {@damage 2d4} lightning damage.
You can end the spell early by using an action to dismiss it.

spell.name: Wall of Lightning
entries: You create a wall of lightning on a solid surface within range. You make a wall up to 60 feet long, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick, or you can make a ringed wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick. The wall is opaque and lasts for the duration.

When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 4d8} lightning damage and is {@condition restrained} for the duration. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage but isn't {@condition restrained}. A {@condition restrained} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a successful save.

One side of the wall, selected by you when you cast this spell, deals {@damage 4d8} lightning damage to each creature that ends its turn within 10 feet of that side or inside the wall. A creature takes the same damage and is subject to the wall's restraining effect when it enters the wall for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. The other side of the wall deals no damage.
entriesHigherLevel: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledice 1d8|5-9|4d8} for each slot above 5th.

spell.name: Frightful Breath

components.m: dried ectoplasm from a {@creature ghost dragon|CCodex}

entries: Icy terror escapes your hands in a screaming torrent. Each living creature in a 30-foot cone must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 5d10} psychic damage and be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature that succeeds on its saving throw takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition frightened}. A {@condition frightened} creature can make another Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a success, the creature is no longer {@condition frightened}.
A creature killed by this spell has a {@chance 10|10%} chance of returning as a ghost.

spell.name: Withering Bite

components.m: tarnished coin from a {@creature ghost dragon|CCodex|ghost dragon's} lair

entries: A ghostly draconic maw superimposes your face when you cast this spell. For the duration, you can use your action to make a melee spell attack against a target within 5 feet. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d10} piercing damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.
entriesHigherLevel: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the necrotic damage increases by {@scaledice 4d8|4-9|1d8} for each slot above 4th.

spell.name: Conjure Void Dragon Wyrmling
entries: You summon a {@creature void dragon wyrmling|CCodex} from the void. The dragon appears in an unoccupied space that you can see within range, and it disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The summoned dragon is friendly to you and your companions for the duration. Roll initiative for the dragon, which has its own turns. It obeys any verbal commands that you issue to it (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to the dragon, it defends itself from hostile creatures but otherwise takes no actions.
entriesHigherLevel: When you cast this spell using certain higher-level spell slots, more dragons appear: two with a 6th-level slot and three with an 8th-level slot. If you cast this spell with a 9th-level slot, you can instead summon a {@creature young void dragon|CCodex}.

spell.name: Impel Void
entries: You infuse a spell you cast with a mere sliver of the Void. One creature that is hit by that spell or that fails a saving throw against that spell is {@condition stunned} until the end of the creature's next turn.

spell.name: Retributive Scream

time.condition: which you take when you take damage

entries: Each creature within range must make a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 2d6} psychic damage.
entriesHigherLevel: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledice 2d6|2-9|1d6} for each slot level above 3rd. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the range increases to 20 feet, and when you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the range increases to 30 feet.

spell.name: Conjure Iron Sphere
entries: You summon an {@creature iron sphere|CCodex}, which appears in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. If you are a {@class cleric}, you can replace the standard {@creature iron sphere|CCodex} with a {@book temple sphere|ExpCCodex|0|Temple Sphere}. The sphere disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The {@creature iron sphere|CCodex} is friendly to you and your companions for the duration. Roll for initiative for the {@creature iron sphere|CCodex}, which has its own turns. It obeys commands that you issue to it (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to the sphere, it defends itself from hostile creatures but otherwise takes no actions.
entriesHigherLevel: When you cast this spell using a 9th-level spell slot, you summon an additional {@creature iron sphere|CCodex}

spell.name: Siege of Iron
entries: Your fists become metallic. Your unarmed strikes deal {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage, your unarmed strikes are magic, and you have a +1 bonus to the attack and damage rolls you make using them. Finally, you deal double damage to objects and structures with your unarmed strikes.

spell.name: Mindless Vengeance

time.condition: which you take when you take damage from a melee weapon attack

entries: You gain physical prowess in response to an attack at the cost of your mental faculties. Upon casting this spell, you drop whatever item you were holding in your primary hand. You can attack with an unarmed strike against the creature that damaged you with the instigating melee weapon attack (if it is in range) as part of the casting of this spell.

For the spell's duration, your unarmed strike uses {@damage 2d4} for damage. When attacking with an unarmed strike, you double your proficiency bonus on your attack roll and add your proficiency bonus on your damage roll.
Conversely, for the spell's duration, you cannot cast spells, and you have disadvantage on Intelligence checks and Intelligence saving throws.

spell.name: Aloofness
entries: This spell causes the creature that you touch to project an air of detachment in all its social dealings. All other creatures that attempt to make Wisdom ({@skill Insight|Source}) checks to determine the target's intentions have disadvantage on those checks.

In addition, a creature that interacts with the target for the duration must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature attempts to curry favor with the target, and the target has advantage on Charisma ({@skill Persuasion|Source}) checks against that creature for the duration, provided a check is made to benefit the target in some way.

spell.name: Evasive Maneuvers

time.condition: which you take when you are subject to a spell or effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take half damage

entries: Upon casting this spell, you gain an innate sense of how to avoid the worst of a damaging spell or effect. If you succeed on the Dexterity saving throw, you take no damage. You only take half damage if you fail the saving throw.

spell.name: Leonino's Mark
entries: You mark a creature you can see as an enemy to cats. The creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw, or felines become hostile toward the creature for the duration. Felines have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|Source}) checks against the target, and they have advantage on saving throws against effects that would cause them to become {@condition frightened} of the target. Felines always attack the target in preference to all other creatures but will not risk their lives to reach the target.

If you can see the target and a feline in combat, you can end the spell, and the feline has advantage on its attack rolls until combat ends. This does not compel the feline to continue fighting the target.

spell.name: Succor's Retribution

time.condition: which you take in response to a creature that healed, restored, strengthened, or otherwise aided another creature

entries: A willing creature you designate within range has advantage on attacks against the target that triggered this spell. The designated creature benefits from this spell for the spell's duration or until it successfully hits the target, whichever occurs first.
entriesHigherLevel: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can designate one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Foul Spray

components.m: a musk gland from an {@creature albino death weasel|CCodex}

entries: Upon casting this spell, a spray of musk emanates from your body. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, a creature can make another Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends for the creature.
entriesHigherLevel: Using a spell slot of 3rd level increases the cone's size to 20 feet. Using a spell slot of 4th level or higher increases the cone's size by 10 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Crushing Depths
entries: You subject one creature you can within range to the pressure found deep underwater. The creature must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it is {@condition restrained} and takes {@damage 2d10} bludgeoning damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and the spell ends.

A creature {@condition restrained} by this spell can make another Strength saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a failure, the creature is {@condition restrained} and takes bludgeoning damage as above, and the damage increases by {@damage 1d10}. On a success, the creature takes half damage and can move at half speed. The spell ends when the creature successfully saves against this spell twice. The successes don't need to be consecutive.

spell.name: Siege Fists
entries: A willing creature you touch becomes destructive. Until the spell ends, if the creature hits a target with an unarmed strike, the hit is a critical hit.
entriesHigherLevel: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature, for each slot level above 2nd. You can imbue a single weapon with this spell in place of two creatures.

spell.name: Ziphian Bribe

m.text: the contents of the bribe, which must equal 100 gp times the creature's challenge rating

entries: This spell imbues a bribe you present to a creature with an aura of friendliness. If the creature willingly accepts the gift, it regards you as a friendly acquaintance for the spell's duration. Alternatively, you can suggest a course of activity as per the {@spell suggestion} spell, but you do not need to concentrate on the spell.
This spell doesn't affect a creature that can't be {@condition charmed}. If you or your companions harm the creature, the spell ends.
Expanding Codex fleshes out monsters from the {@i Creature Codex}, giving GMs ways to modify the existing monsters to surprise well-prepared players or to introduce monsters to a campaign.
A soft-bodied iridescent creature floats by, tentacles rippling along its back as it quests for its next meal...

entries.name: Alternate Traits and Actions
entries: The following changes allow GMs to alter an {@creature arcanaphage|CCodex} without modifying its challenge rating.

entries.name: Diviniphage
entries: A diviniphage feeds solely on divine magic but still interacts with all types of magic. It is immune to damage from divine spells. It has advantage on saving throws against other spells and magical effects. Its Hunger trait regains hp equal to three times the level of the spell and increases its Feed score by 2 each time it feeds in combat. Additionally, when it applies its Ingest Magic trait or uses its Voracious reaction, it can only feed on divine spells it ends or counters. Finally, when it dies and applies its Arcane Discharge trait, the force damage dealt by this trait is replaced with either radiant or necrotic damage.
The diviniphage loses the {@creature arcanaphage|CCodex|arcanaphage's} Magic Immunity trait, and other traits and reactions are modified as indicated above.

entries.name: Magic Sight
entries: The {@creature arcanaphage|CCodex} senses magic within 90 feet of it at will. This trait otherwise works like the {@spell detect magic} spell but isn't itself magical.
The arcanaphage's {@sense blindsight} is reduced to 30 ft.

entries.name: Selective Eater
entries: The {@creature arcanaphage|CCodex} is predominantly exposed to one school of magic (abjuration, conjuration, and so on), so it has adapted its feeding to better consume such magic. It is immune to spells and magical effects from its chosen school and has advantage on saving throws against other spells and magical effects. Its Hunger trait regains hp equal to four times the level of the spell and increases its Feed score by 2 for the selected school, but it regains hp equal to the level of the spell and increases its Feed score by 1/2 for all other schools. For purposes of its Arcane Discharge trait, ignore fractional values. Additionally, when its Ingest Magic trait applies, a creature maintaining concentration on a spell from the {@creature arcanaphage|CCodex|arcanaphage's} selected school has disadvantage on its Constitution saving throw. Finally, when the {@creature arcanaphage|CCodex} uses its Voracious reaction, it has advantage on its spellcasting ability check when countering a spell from its chosen school.
The {@creature arcanaphage|CCodex} loses its Magic Immunity trait, and other traits and reactions are modified as indicated above.

entries.name: True Arcanaphage
entries: A true {@creature arcanaphage|CCodex} feeds solely on arcane magic but still interacts with all types of magic. It is immune to damage from arcane spells. It has advantage on saving throws against other spells and magical effects. Its Hunger trait regains hp equal to three times the level of the spell and increases its Feed score by 2 each time it feeds in combat. Additionally, when it applies its Ingest Magic trait or uses its Voracious reaction, it can only feed on arcane spells it ends or counters. Finally, its Arcane Discharge trait deals 4 ({@damage 1d8}) force damage per Feed score to a creature that fails its Dexterity saving throw and deals 9 ({@damage 2d8}) force damage to a creature that starts its turn in the affected area.
The true {@creature arcanaphage|CCodex} loses the {@creature arcanaphage|CCodex|arcanaphage's} Magic Immunity trait, and other traits and reactions are modified as indicated above.

entries.name: New Magic Items and Spells
entries: The following magic item and spell are inspired by abilities possessed by an {@creature arcanaphage|CCodex}.

entries.name: Arcanaphage Adventure Hooks
entries: There are many adventures that can showcase an {@creature arcanaphage|CCodex}:

items: A wizard asks the PCs to capture a live {@creature arcanaphage|CCodex} specimen in a lead-lined jar she provides. She pays well for their trouble and ensures they are aware of the threat posed by the creature. She refuses to tell the PCs she plans to release the {@creature arcanaphage|CCodex} in a rival's laboratory.

A collective of {@creature arcanaphage|CCodex|arcanaphages} has devoured all magic in the dimension they inhabit. The creatures wriggle their way, one per day, through a rift leading from their home dimension to a large city. The city's leaders ask the PCs to close the rift before the {@creature arcanaphage|CCodex|arcanaphages} can wreak havoc on the city.

entries: As the tome is opened, a blob of ink splashes toward the reader's eyes, followed by mischievous giggles...

entries.name: Alternate Traits and Actions
entries: The following creatures allow GMs to alter a {@creature bookkeeper|CCodex} without modifying its challenge rating.

entries.name: Creator's Mark
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}The {@creature bookkeeper|CCodex} marks the target with an invisible rune, which it and its creator can see. The mark can be removed with a {@spell dispel magic} or similar magic.
The {@creature bookkeeper|CCodex} loses its bite attack.

entries.name: Dual Binding
entries: The {@creature bookkeeper|CCodex} is attuned to two books rather than a single tome. It can use its Between the Lines trait to jump between books provided they are within range of each other. Its hp maximum reduction from its Book Bound trait only applies if it is farther than 60 feet from both books. Both books the {@creature bookkeeper|CCodex} are bound to are destroyed when it dies.
Stretching the {@creature bookkeeper|CCodex|bookkeeper's} magic across two books gives it the Antimagic Susceptibility trait:

items: {@b {@i Antimagic Susceptibility.}} The {@creature bookkeeper|CCodex} is {@condition incapacitated} while in an area of an {@spell antimagic field}. If targeted by {@spell dispel magic}, the {@creature bookkeeper|CCodex} must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute.

entries.name: Nauseating Ink
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +4} to hit, range 20 ft., one target {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution save or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.
The {@creature bookkeeper|CCodex} loses its Ink Splash action.

entries.name: Possess Reader (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: The fiendish {@creature bookkeeper|CCodex} treats its book as a container for a {@spell magic jar} spell. It can possess a humanoid per the {@spell magic jar} spell (save DC 9) if the humanoid moves within 60 feet of it. The {@creature bookkeeper|CCodex} can only possess a target for 10 minutes before it must return to its book. A DC 13 Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check notices ink flowing through the whites of the possessed creature's eyes, and a DC 13 Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check discovers the possession.
The fiendish {@creature bookkeeper|CCodex} loses its X Marks the Spot trait.

entries.name: Spell Attunement {@recharge 4}
entries: The {@creature bookkeeper|CCodex} has access to a 1st-level spell within its book. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 9, {@hit +1} to hit with spell attacks). It can use an action to innately cast the spell, requiring no material components.
The {@creature bookkeeper|CCodex} loses its Elusive Pages action.

entries.name: New Magic Items and Spells
entries: The following magic items and spell are inspired by abilities possessed by a {@creature bookkeeper|CCodex}.

entries.name: Bookkeeper Adventure Hooks
entries: There are many adventures that can showcase a {@creature bookkeeper|CCodex}:

items: A lonely {@creature bookkeeper|CCodex}, the creation of an eccentric wizard who read from the creature's bound book every day, regards the first creature that touches its book as its new "creator," which does not require a Charisma check. The {@creature bookkeeper|CCodex} demands the resumption of its former creator's activity, requiring 30 minutes of reading from its current creator. If the creature does not receive the appropriate attention, it flies around its creator, distracting them so much the creator has disadvantage on a check or attack. A successful DC 13 Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check calms the creature for a day, but the DC increases by 1 for every day the creator does not read to it.

A kobold bookseller peppers her books with {@creature bookkeeper|CCodex|bookkeepers}, which she employs as spies. The {@creature bookkeeper|CCodex|bookkeepers} induce minor damage to their books to encourage their "owners" to contact the bookseller for repairs. This system has worked well for the kobold until a recent spate of murders where the victims were found with ink stains around their noses and mouths, indicating some inky creature had suffocated them. The kobold seeks to clear its name and discover the true culprit, which could be an {@creature ink devil|ToB} (see {@loader Tome of Beasts|creature/Kobold Press; Tome of Beasts.json}) or a more powerful inky creature.

entries: With a fang-filled maw and the glimmer of malevolent intelligence in its ruby eyes, this shark-like creature glides through the depths in complete silence...

entries.name: Alternate Traits and Actions
entries: The following changes allow GMs to alter a {@creature devil shark|CCodex} without modifying its challenge rating.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: The {@creature devil shark|CCodex} can breathe air and water. It also has a speed of 10 feet.
The {@creature devil shark|CCodex} loses its Water Breathing trait. Additionally, its swim speed is reduced to 40 feet.

entries.name: Crushing Charge
entries: If the {@creature devil shark|CCodex} swims at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and hits with a slam attack on the same turn, the target takes an additional 22 ({@damage 4d10}) bludgeoning damage and must succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throw or be knocked 20 feet away from the {@creature devil shark|CCodex}.
The {@creature devil shark|CCodex} gains a slam melee weapon attack, and its bite attack is modified:

items: {@b {@i Bite.}} {@atk mw} {@hit +12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) piercing damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape DC 18).
{@b {@i Slam.}} {@atk mw} {@hit +12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Icy Belly
entries: A creature swallowed by the {@creature devil shark|CCodex} takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage and 10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage at the start of each of the {@creature devil shark|CCodex|devil shark's} turns.
This trait modifies the {@creature devil shark|CCodex|devil shark's} Swallow action.

entries.name: Summon Giant Shark (1/Day)
entries: The {@creature devil shark|CCodex} summons {@dice 1d4} sharks. A summoned shark appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the {@creature devil shark|CCodex}, acts as an ally, and remains for 1 minute.
The {@creature devil shark|CCodex} loses its Magic Resistance trait when it gains the Summon Giant Shark action.

entries.name: Vortex {@recharge 4}
entries: The {@creature devil shark|CCodex} creates a vortex of water within 30 feet of it that lasts for 1 minute. The vortex is 5 feet in diameter and up to 30 feet tall. A creature occupying the space where the vortex appears or entering the vortex for the first time on a turn must make a DC 18 Dexterity save or be {@condition restrained} and take {@damage 2d8} bludgeoning damage. As an action, a creature can free itself or another creature from a vortex by succeeding on a DC 18 Strength check.
The {@creature devil shark|CCodex} loses its Freezing Breath action.

entries.name: New Magic Items and Spells
entries: The following magic items and spell are inspired by abilities possessed by a {@creature devil shark|CCodex}.

entries.name: Devil Shark Adventure Hooks
entries: There are many adventures that can showcase a {@creature devil shark|CCodex}:

items: A {@creature sahuagin} cult near a coast featuring a large settlement vows revenge on the land-based creatures who have thwarted their invasion attempts. To that end, they plan to conduct a ritual to call a pair of {@creature devil shark|CCodex|devil sharks} to the waters near the settlement and offer themselves up as sacrifices to ensure the sharks devastate the landbound populace. A fisherwoman stumbled upon the cult and learned they planned something nefarious. She made a narrow escape and couldn't get more details however. The settlement is not equipped to deal with the cult in their own element and require outside assistance to thwart the {@creature sahuagin} plot.

A ship carrying a valuable cargo was due to reach port two days ago. By all accounts, weather shouldn't have delayed the ship's arrival. The ship's owners as well as the cargo's recipients fear a {@creature devil shark|CCodex} possibly sensed the vessel's importance and attacked. Those brave enough to locate the ship, retrieve the cargo, and rescue potential survivors, stand to receive a considerable reward.

entries: A pale drake drifts through the air like a leaf on the surface of a pond, barely moving its billowing, cloaklike wings. Its large, jet-black eyes stare skyward but reflect no light...

entries.name: Alternate Traits and Actions
entries: The following changes allow GMs to alter {@creature moon drake|CCodex|moon drakes} without modifying its challenge rating.

entries.name: Mooncurse Slash (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}The target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become cursed with lycanthropy (the {@creature moon drake|CCodex} chooses the type of lycanthrope). A creature that previously suffered from lycanthropy (even if it was cured) makes its saving throw with disadvantage. A lycanthrope has advantage on its saving throw. If a lycanthrope fails, it changes to the type chosen by the drake. This attack can't affect a natural-born lycanthrope.

A GM who wishes to randomize the type of lycanthrope can do so as follows, on a roll of a {@dice d10}: 1: {@creature werebear}, 2: {@creature wereboar}, 3: {@creature weretiger}, 4–6: {@creature wererat}, 7–10: {@creature werewolf}.
The {@creature moon drake|CCodex} replaces the Moonlight Nip action with Mooncurse Slash.

entries.name: Shiftersense
entries: The {@creature moon drake|CCodex} can sense the presence of shapeshifters within 30 feet.
The {@creature moon drake|CCodex|moon drake's} {@sense darkvision} is reduced to 60 ft.

entries.name: New Magic Item and Spells
entries: The following magic item and spells are inspired by a {@creature moon drake|CCodex|moon drake's} abilities.

entries.name: Moon Drake Adventure Hooks
entries: There are many adventures that can showcase a {@creature moon drake|CCodex}:

items: The leader of a {@creature werebear} clan asks the PCs to stop a creature that has been transforming her clan into ordinary humans. The PCs discover a pack of {@creature werewolf||werewolves} have tricked the {@creature moon drake|CCodex} into curing the {@creature werebear||werebears} and weakening the clan, leaving the former {@creature werewolf||werebears} open to attack by the {@creature werewolf||werewolves}. If the PCs can negotiate with the drake, they might be able to turn the tables on the {@creature werewolf||werewolves}.

If the PCs research cures for lycanthropy after one of the party is bitten by a {@creature wererat}, they discover the location of a {@creature moon drake|CCodex|moon drake's} lair at the top of a tall mountain. Reaching the drake is difficult. Once the PCs find the drake, it is amenable to removing the curse from the afflicted PC. However, it may ask them to help eradicate the {@creature wererat} nest or perform a similar task as repayment.

entries: The thief pushed a clinking bag across the desk, but the pact drake hissed and spit, making it clear that the law could not be bent, even for a handsome price...

entries.name: Alternate Traits and Actions
entries: The following changes allow GMs to alter a {@creature pact drake|CCodex} without modifying its challenge rating.

entries.name: Appoint Notary
entries: As an action, the {@creature pact drake|CCodex} designates a willing creature to witness a pact or agreement on the drake's behalf. The designated creature gains the drake's Binding Witness trait and Punish Transgressor action for the pact or agreement it witnesses. It also gains the ability to cast {@spell scrying} three times per day, using its Charisma as its spellcasting ability. The designated creature can only scry on parties involved in the agreement. The drake relinquishes its abilities with respect to the agreement.
The drake can revoke this designation as a bonus action. When it does so, it regains the Binding Witness trait and the Punish Transgressor action with respect to the pact or agreement.
The {@creature pact drake|CCodex} loses its Enforced Diplomacy action.

entries.name: Teleport to Transgressor (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: The {@creature pact drake|CCodex} is psychically linked to each pact and agreement it witnesses. If a creature breaks a drake-brokered contract, the drake can teleport unerringly to the transgressor's location up to an hour afterward. The teleportation fails if the target creature is no longer on the same plane as the drake.
The {@creature pact drake|CCodex} loses the ability to cast {@spell arcane eye} and {@spell clairvoyance}.

entries.name: Visceral Punisher
entries: As a bonus action, the drake chooses a single creature within 60 feet that broke the terms of a pact witnessed by the drake. Until the target creature is dead or it has offered compensation for breaking the terms of the pact, the drake has advantage on attacks against the target and on saving throws against spells or other magical effects originating from the target. Additionally, the drake's melee attacks deal double damage to the target.
The {@creature pact drake|CCodex} loses its Punish Transgressor action.

entries.name: New Magic Items and Spells
entries: The following magic items and spell are inspired by abilities possessed by a pact drake.

entries.name: Pact Drake Adventure Hooks
entries: There are many adventures that can showcase a {@creature pact drake|CCodex}:

items: A powerful noble unwittingly signed an infernal contract with an archdevil, and her soul is forfeit unless she can find a loophole in the contract. A {@creature pact drake|CCodex} known to oppose archdevils is the best creature to scrutinize the contract, and the noble offers a considerable reward to retain the drake's services. The archdevil won't give up his prize and tries to thwart any attempt to locate and hire the drake. He first sends his minions to harass, injure, or kill the noble's hired protectors, and then he resorts to making a tempting offer of power or wealth with no strings attached.

A vigilante murders known oath breakers rather than allow the law to punish them. The creature responsible for the killings is a {@creature pact drake|CCodex} who had brokered an agreement that one of the parties subsequently breached, resulting in an innocent person's demise. Investigators uncover a gang of kobolds working for the drake. Negotiation or subterfuge leads investigators to the {@creature pact drake|CCodex|pact drake's} lair in an abandoned barrister's office. The {@creature pact drake|CCodex} refuses to stop his hunt for those who break contracts or their word. If the drake senses his pursuers are amenable, he offers them employment in his network.

entries: An enormous viper formed of green liquid curls upward, its dripping fangs ready to strike...

entries.name: Alternate Traits and Actions
entries: The following changes allow GMs to alter a {@creature venom elemental|CCodex} without modifying its challenge rating.

entries.name: Air Form
entries: Aerosolized versions of the {@creature venom elemental|CCodex} are rarer than their liquid cousins on the demiplane of poisons. The {@creature venom elemental|CCodex} can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. The elemental gains a flying speed of 60 feet.
The {@creature venom elemental|CCodex} also gains the Aerial Camouflage trait.
The {@creature venom elemental|CCodex} loses its swimming speed and its Liquid Form and Underwater Camouflage traits.

items: {@b {@i Aerial Camouflage.}} While the elemental is flying it has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks.

entries.name: Engulf
entries: Each creature in the {@creature venom elemental|CCodex|venom elemental's} space must make a DC 13 Strength saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage, and the creature must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn. If the target is Large or smaller, it is also {@condition grappled} (escape DC 13). Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and unable to breathe unless it can breathe water. If the saving throw is successful, the target is pushed out of the elemental's space.

The {@creature venom elemental|CCodex} can grapple one Large creature or up to two Medium or smaller creatures at one time. At the start of the elemental's turn, each target {@condition grappled} by it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage and must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn. A creature within 5 feet of the elemental can pull a creature out of it by taking an action to make a DC 13 Strength check and succeeding.
The {@creature venom elemental|CCodex} loses its Multiattack action.

entries.name: Envenom Liquid
entries: As an action, the {@creature venom elemental|CCodex} divests a portion of its body into a pint of liquid. The elemental's hit point maximum is reduced by {@dice 1d6} hit points, and this reduction lasts until the elemental finishes a short rest. The venom retains its potency for 1 hour before dissolution. A creature drinking the envenomed liquid must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage and gain the {@condition poisoned} condition for 1 minute.
The {@creature venom elemental|CCodex} gains the Vulnerability to Antitoxin trait:

items: {@b {@i Vulnerability to Antitoxin.}} When the {@creature venom elemental|CCodex} is struck by a vial of antitoxin (thrown as an improvised weapon), it takes {@damage 2d6} acid damage. Additionally, until the end of its next turn, creatures gain resistance to poison damage dealt by the elemental and have advantage on Constitution saving throws to avoid becoming {@condition poisoned} by the elemental.

entries.name: Spit Venom
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +5} to hit, range 15/30 ft., one target. {@h}The target must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. On a failed save, the creature gains the {@condition poisoned} condition until the end of its next turn.
The {@creature venom elemental|CCodex} modifies its Multiattack action to make two attacks: one with its bite and one with its spit venom.

entries.name: New Magic Items and Spells
entries: The following magic item and spell are inspried by abilities possessed by a {@creature venom elemental|CCodex}.

entries.name: Venom Elemental Adventure Hooks
entries: There are many adventures that can showcase a {@creature venom elemental|CCodex}:

items: Several people at a lakeside village have become sick after swimming along the shore. The inhabitants blame a neighboring village for poisoning their water, but the real culprit is a {@creature venom elemental|CCodex}.

A cabal of serpent cultists devoted to a snake demon is set to perform a ritual to summon a dozen {@creature venom elemental|CCodex|venom elementals} to poison a large city's water supply and set the creatures on the city's inhabitants. The cultists intend to sacrifice poisoned victims to the demon in the desire to call forth the demon.

entries: This tree-like creature's hide is charred, cracked, and oozing. A crown of long, branching tentacles set with goat-like eyes encircles a central fanged maw at the top of its bulk. Root-like appendages end in blackened, sooty hooves...

entries.name: Alternate Traits and Actions
entries: The following allow GMs to alter a {@creature flame-scourged scion|CCodex} without modifying its challenge rating.

entries.name: Blight Burst {@recharge}
entries: The {@creature flame-scourged scion|CCodex} showers the area around itself with the ooze leaking from its skin. Each creature within 10 feet of the {@creature flame-scourged scion|CCodex} must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 6d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. Plant creatures make this saving throw with disadvantage, and nonmagical plants that aren't creatures wither and die without a saving throw.
The {@creature flame-scourged scion|CCodex} loses its Embers action.

entries.name: Fiery Rage
entries: When a {@creature flame-scourged scion|CCodex} takes fire damage, it inflicts an additional {@damage 1d6} fire damage with its melee weapon attacks. If it takes more than 5 fire damage, it instead inflicts an additional {@damage 1d10} fire damage. The {@creature flame-scourged scion|CCodex} gains this extra damage until the end of its next turn.
The {@creature flame-scourged scion|CCodex} loses its Burning Rage trait.

entries.name: Kick
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. The target must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
A {@creature flame-scourged scion|CCodex} with a kick attack makes two tentacle attacks and one kick attack when taking the Multiattack action.

entries.name: New Magic Items and Spells
entries: The following magic items and spell are inspired by abilities possessed by a {@creature flame-scourged scion|CCodex}.

entries.name: Flame-scourged Scion Adventure Hooks
entries: There are many adventures that can showcase a {@creature flame-scourged scion|CCodex}:

items: Once per week, another cow from one rancher's herd goes missing. He claims he'd seen a strange tree looming at the edge of his ranch just as the sun set before one of his cows disappeared. Though he hasn't got the physical might to take on the {@creature flame-scourged scion|CCodex} preying on his cattle, and no one believes him, he offers a large sum to travelers who might take on his plight.

A coterie of {@creature flame-scourged scion|CCodex|flame-scourged scions} has infiltrated a deep-forest's glade situated on a ley line. They intend to restore their dark goddess to her former might, but they require humanoid cultists as well as humanoid sacrifices to enact the necessary ritual. Fortunately for the {@creature flame-scourged scion|CCodex|flame-scourged scions}, a schism among a nature deity's followers has befallen a nearby village, allowing the creatures to lure potential acolytes to their glade. The nature deity's remaining followers implore adventurers to locate their wayward cohort.

entries: What seemed to be a storm cloud takes the shape of a feline predator. Flashes of lightning course through its semisolid body as it strikes with overwhelming speed...

entries.name: Alternate Traits and Actions
entries: The following changes allow GMs to alter a {@creature fulminar|CCodex} without modifying its challenge rating.

entries.name: Forked Lightning
entries: When the {@creature fulminar|CCodex} flies at least 10 feet, it creates a duplicate lightning form that potentially fools attackers. Until the beginning of its next turn, after it moves, attack rolls against it have disadvantage. If it is hit by an attack, this trait is disrupted until it moves again.
The {@creature fulminar|CCodex} loses its Flyby and Essence of Lightning traits.

entries.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) thunder damage, and the target must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target is {@condition stunned} until the end of the fulminar's next turn and {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. On a success, the target is {@condition deafened} until the end of the fulminar's next turn but isn't {@condition stunned}. A {@condition deafened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
The {@creature fulminar|CCodex} loses its bite attack and replaces its bite attack with the slam attack when taking a Multiattack action.

entries.name: Thunderous Roar {@recharge 5}
entries: The {@creature fulminar|CCodex} unleashes a roar similar to the overwhelming thunderclap created in a lightning strike's immediate area. Each creature within 30 feet of it must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) thunder damage, is knocked {@condition prone}, and is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. On a success, the target takes half the damage but isn't knocked {@condition prone} or {@condition deafened}.
The {@creature fulminar|CCodex} loses its Lightning Shackles action. Alternatively, it retains its Lightning Shackles action with Recharge {@dice 1d6|6} for both actions.

entries.name: Alternate Cloud Giant Innate Spellcasting
entries: The following change helps to highlight the alliance between {@creature cloud giant||cloud giants} and {@creature fulminar|CCodex|fulminars}.

The {@creature cloud giant} replaces the {@spell control weather} spell with {@spell conjure elemental}, which can only be cast to call forth a {@creature fulminar|CCodex}. If the caster's concentration is broken, the {@creature fulminar|CCodex} won't become hostile to the caster or the caster's {@creature cloud giant} allies, but it might flee or become hostile to non-cloud giant allies.

entries.name: New Magic Items and Spells
entries: The following magic item and spells are inspried by abilities possessed by a {@creature fulminar|CCodex}.

entries.name: Fulminar Adventure Hooks
entries: There are many adventures that can showcase a {@creature fulminar|CCodex}:

items: A {@creature fulminar|CCodex}, with which a {@creature cloud giant} has established a mutual friendship, disappeared shortly after the PCs passed through the giant's territory. The angry giant demands the party return her {@creature fulminar|CCodex}. If the PCs manage to convince the giant they are not responsible for the fulminar's disappearance, she offers a substantial reward to help her locate the creature.

Villagers cower in fear at nightly attacks made by a {@creature fulminar|CCodex}, dispatched by a {@creature djinni} to locate and destroy an {@creature efreeti} who hides in the village and uses magic to disguise himself.

entries: In the empty dragon's lair with no trace of treasure or beast, a cold breeze from nowhere wafts through the chamber. A wavering draconic form fades into sight, its hissing anger leaking out through translucent teeth...

entries.name: Alternate Traits and Actions
entries: The following changes allow GMs to alter a {@creature ghost dragon|CCodex} without modifying its challenge rating.

entries.name: Possess Dragon {@recharge 5}
entries: One dragon that the {@creature ghost dragon|CCodex} can see within 10 feet of it must succeed on a DC 16 Charisma saving throw or be possessed by the {@creature ghost dragon|CCodex}. The {@creature ghost dragon|CCodex} then disappears, and the target is {@condition incapacitated} and loses control of its body. The {@creature ghost dragon|CCodex} now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The {@creature ghost dragon|CCodex} can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect except ones that turn undead, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.

The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the {@creature ghost dragon|CCodex} ends it as a bonus action, or the ghost is turned or forced out by an effect like the {@spell dispel evil and good} spell. When the possession ends, the {@creature ghost dragon|CCodex} reappears in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of the body. The target is immune to this {@creature ghost dragon|CCodex|ghost dragon's} Possess Dragon for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.
The {@creature ghost dragon|CCodex} loses its Horrifying Breath attack. Alternatively, the recharge for this action and for Horrifying Breath can be modified to recharge on 6.

entries.name: Shade of Life Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The {@creature ghost dragon|CCodex} exhales a blast of energy reminiscent of its former existence combined with the terrible energy powering its current existence. Each living creature in the {@creature ghost dragon|CCodex|ghost dragon's} 30-foot-cone blast must make a DC 17 {@footnote Reflex|Probably means "Dexterity".} saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 5d10}) damage based on the living dragon's breath (acid, cold, fire, and so on, but the damage type doesn't change) and 27 ({@damage 5d10}) psychic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A living dragon that fails its saving throw must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
The {@creature ghost dragon|CCodex} loses its Horrifying Breath attack.

entries.name: New Magic Items and Spells
entries: The following magic items and spell are inspired by abilities possessed by a ghost dragon.

entries.name: Ghost Dragon Adventure Hooks
entries: There are many adventures that can showcase a {@creature ghost dragon|CCodex}:

items: A red dragon haunting a mountain range has gone quiet, raising faint hope in the kingdom plagued by the dragon. The kingdom's ruler asks for a stalwart group to investigate the dragon's lack of activity and return with treasure from its lair if the group slays the dragon or in the unlikely event the dragon has perished on its own. In truth, a usurping red dragon killed the older dragon but fled when the slain dragon returned as a {@creature ghost dragon|CCodex}.

A gold dragon dying of old age intended to distribute its treasure to various charities and heroic groups. Though it slipped its mortal coil, the dragon's ghost remained compelled to complete its unfinished business. It now seeks individuals who can complete its task while guarding its hoard from greedy treasure seekers.

entries: Covered in writhing tattoos, the giant whispers strange words to itself...

entries.name: Alternate Traits and Actions
entries: The following changes allow GMs to alter a {@creature void giant|CCodex} without modifying its challenge rating.

entries.name: Deep Void Casting {@recharge 4}
entries: As a bonus action, the {@creature void giant|CCodex} can infuse a spell with powerful void magic. One creature that is hit by that spell or that fails a saving throw against that spell is {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. The creature can make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
The {@creature void giant|CCodex} loses its Void Casting trait. Its Magic Absorption reaction is modified as follows.

items: {@b {@i Magic Absorption.}} If the {@creature void giant|CCodex} succeeds on a saving throw against an enemy spell, the {@creature void giant|CCodex} doesn't suffer the effects of that spell. If it uses Deep Void Casting on its next turn, the {@creature void giant|CCodex} can affect all creatures hit by its spell or that fail a saving throw against its spell instead of just one creature. Creatures that attempt Wisdom saving throws at the end of their turns to end the effect have advantage on their saving throws.

entries.name: Summon Void Dragon
entries: The {@creature void giant|CCodex} summons a {@creature void dragon wyrmling|ToB} (see {@loader Tome of Beasts|creature/Kobold Press; Tome of Beasts.json}), which appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner and acts as an ally of its summoner. It remains for 10 minutes, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.
The giant reduces its 4th-level spellcasting slots to two slots and loses the ability to cast {@spell phantasmal killer}.

entries.name: Void Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}25 (4d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.
The {@creature void giant|CCodex} loses its slam and Multiattack actions.

entries.name: New Magic items and Spells
entries: The following magic item and spells are inspired by abilities possessed by a {@creature void giant|CCodex}.

entries.name: Void Giant Adventure Hooks
entries: There are many adventures that can showcase a {@creature void giant|CCodex}:

items: A {@creature void giant|CCodex} searching for a lair for its void dragon master settles upon a village with a thin connection to the Void. The village leaders plead with the giant to not uproot the villagers from their homes, but their pleas fell on deaf ears. The villagers can't confront the giant directly, and they look for outside help to persuade the giant to leave or kill it if necessary.

A {@creature void giant|CCodex} has gained freedom from its void dragon master. Its cageyness about the circumstances suggest its incompetence caused the dragon to die, or the giant had a more direct hand in the dragon's death. Regardless, it seeks the {@creature cloud giant} clan to which it belongs and wishes to hire a competent group to assist in its mission.

entries: A tiny flower with shining black petals sways lightly on its thorny stem...

entries.name: Alternate Traits and Actions
entries: The following changes allow GMs to alter a {@creature gloomflower|CCodex} without modifying its challenge rating.

entries.name: Focused Scream
entries: Whenever the {@creature gloomflower|CCodex} takes damage, if the creature dealing the damage is within range of the {@creature gloomflower|CCodex|gloomflower's} {@sense blindsight}, the creature must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage.
The {@creature gloomflower|CCodex} loses its Psychic Scream trait.

entries.name: Howling Darkness (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The {@creature gloomflower|CCodex} creates a 15-foot-radius sphere of magical darkness at a point it can sense within 60 feet. This darkness works like the {@spell darkness} spell, except creatures inside it have disadvantage on saving throws against any of the {@creature gloomflower|CCodex|gloomflower's} actions or traits.
The {@creature gloomflower|CCodex} loses its Blur trait.

entries.name: Soul Splice
entries: The {@creature gloomflower|CCodex} places the soul belonging to its corpse into a creature it can sense within 90 feet, creating an effect like the {@spell magic jar} spell. The {@creature gloomflower|CCodex} can use this power at will, but it can only splice its soul onto one other creature at a time. The target resists the attack with a successful DC 14 Charisma saving throw. While the soul is inside the target, the target is {@condition unconscious} and takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage at the start of each of its turns. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a success, the creature remains {@condition unconscious} until the start of its next turn and is immune to the same {@creature gloomflower|CCodex|gloomflower's} Soul Splice for 24 hours.

If the target is reduced to 0 hp by Soul Splice's psychic damage, it must make death saving throws until it dies, stabilizes, or regains hit points, as usual. If the creature stabilizes or regains hit points, the soul returns to the corpse tied to the {@creature gloomflower|CCodex}, the creature is immune to the same {@creature gloomflower|CCodex|gloomflower's} Soul Splice for 24 hours, and the {@creature gloomflower|CCodex} cannot use this action again until it finishes a long rest.
The {@creature gloomflower|CCodex} loses its Corrupting Visions action.

entries.name: New Magic Items and Spells
entries: The following magic item and spells are inspired by abilities possessed by a {@creature gloomflower|CCodex}.

entries.name: Gloomflower Adventure Hooks
entries: There are many adventures that can showcase a {@creature gloomflower|CCodex}:

items: A wizard has divined that a {@creature gloomflower|CCodex} grows adjacent to the location where his colleague perished in the Shadow Realm. He has no desire to travel beyond the confines of his home but intends to handsomely pay anyone who undertakes his request to return the {@creature gloomflower|CCodex}, which contains his colleague's soul within it. The soul's disjointed memories contain dark dealings conducted by the wizard.

A gardener, forever affected by an accidental journey to the Shadow Realm, tends a plot of {@creature gloomflower|CCodex|gloomflowers} in a darkened greenhouse. Once a month, he seeks out a victim whose corpse and soul provides a new home for one of his prized flowers.

entries: An iron ball covered in black panels sits at the statue's feet. It seems slightly out of place, its surface smooth and bright...

entries.name: Alternate Traits and Actions
entries: The following changes allow GMs to alter an {@creature iron sphere|CCodex} without modifying its challenge rating.

entries.name: Acid Jet {@recharge 5}
entries: The {@creature iron sphere|CCodex} extends a nozzle from an open panel and shoots a stream of acid in a 20-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) acid damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.
The {@creature iron sphere|CCodex} loses its Lightning Cannon action.

entries.name: Autonomous Flight
entries: The {@creature iron sphere|CCodex} has a fly speed of 30 feet.
The {@creature iron sphere|CCodex} loses its burrow and climb speeds, and it loses its Standing Leap and Tunneler traits.

entries.name: Cold Iron Weapons
entries: The {@creature iron sphere|CCodex|iron sphere's} melee attacks count as cold iron for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to attacks and damage.
The {@creature iron sphere|CCodex} loses its damage resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks made with cold iron.

entries.name: Dual-Weaponized
entries: The {@creature iron sphere|CCodex} has two of the following actions: Acid Jet, Flamethrower, Ice Catapult, and Lightning Cannon. Each action recharges on {@dice 1d6|6}.
The {@creature iron sphere|CCodex} replaces its Lightning Cannon action with Dual-Weaponized.

entries.name: Flamethrower {@recharge 5}
entries: The {@creature iron sphere|CCodex} extends a nozzle from an open panel and releases a fan of fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that cone must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.
The {@creature iron sphere|CCodex} loses its Lightning Cannon action.

entries.name: Ice Catapult {@recharge 5}
entries: The {@creature iron sphere|CCodex} extends an arm from an open panel and lofts an icy sphere up to 20 feet away that explodes in 10-footradius sphere centered on the sphere's point of impact. Each creature in that sphere must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) cold damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.
The {@creature iron sphere|CCodex} loses its Lightning Cannon action.

entries.name: Silvered
entries: The {@creature iron sphere|CCodex|iron sphere's} melee attacks count as silvered for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to attacks and damage.
The {@creature iron sphere|CCodex} loses its damage resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that are silvered.

entries.name: Temple Sphere
entries: The {@creature iron sphere|CCodex} is consecrated to a specific deity. It will not attack creatures wearing or presenting the deity's holy symbol. The sphere has advantage on attack rolls against creatures regarded as enemies to the deity, and these creatures have disadvantage on saving throws against the sphere's special abilities. Additionally, the sphere gains the Deific Burst attack:

items: {@b {@i Deific Burst {@recharge 5}.}} The {@creature iron sphere|CCodex} unleashes a burst of holy or unholy energy in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on the sphere. Each creature in that sphere must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) necrotic or radiant (or other damage type, as appropriate to the deity) damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries: This trait and attack replace the {@creature iron sphere|CCodex|iron sphere's} Siege Monster trait and Lightning Cannon attack.

entries.name: New Magic Items and Spells
entries: The following magic items and spell are inspired by abilities possessed by an {@creature iron sphere|CCodex}.

entries.name: Iron Sphere Adventure Hooks
entries: There are many adventures that can showcase an {@creature iron sphere|CCodex}:

items: An {@creature iron sphere|CCodex} and its control gem come up for auction, and a wealthy buyer enlists the PCs to bid on the construct. The buyer believes another interested person plans to obtain the sphere legitimately or not and warns the PCs to be alert for any underhanded activity. Additionally, the auctioneer is part of a thieves' guild and plans to substitute the control gem with a fake that works for one day before reverting control to the true gem.

An adventuring party, not realizing what they possessed, paid their tab at a tavern with an {@creature iron sphere|CCodex} control gem. The {@creature iron sphere|CCodex} tied to the gem followed it to the tavern where it patrols the alleyways around the building. This has resulted in several attacks, most fatal, by an unseen assailant who seemingly uses a wide variety of weapons. The authorities or the tavern owner may ask the PCs to investigate.

entries: From behind the collection of angry kobolds steps a creature the size of a dwarf, its bulging muscles flexing as its kobold-like snout twists into a terrible grin...

entries.name: Alternate Traits and Actions
entries: The following changes allow GMs to alter a {@creature swolbold|CCodex} without modifying its challenge rating.

entries.name: Audience-Driven Overconfidence
entries: The {@creature swolbold|CCodex} has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the {@creature swolbold|CCodex|swolbold's} allies is within view of the {@creature swolbold|CCodex} and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}. After its turn, and until a creature successfully hits the {@creature swolbold|CCodex} with a weapon attack or the beginning of its next turn, whichever comes first, creatures attacking the {@creature swolbold|CCodex} make weapon attacks with advantage.
The {@creature swolbold|CCodex} loses its Pack Tactics trait.

entries.name: Bulk Out (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, a {@creature swolbold|CCodex} can increase in size for 1 minute. While the {@creature swolbold|CCodex} is larger, its slam attack deals an extra {@damage 1d4} damage, the escape DC for its grapple and the Strength saving throw DC for its Crush action increase by 2, and it has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. For the duration, its AC is reduced by 2, and it has disadvantage on Dexterity checks and Dexterity saving throws.
The {@creature swolbold|CCodex} loses its Leaping Attack trait.

entries.name: Stranglehold
entries: One creature grappled by the {@creature swolbold|CCodex} must make a DC 14 Strength saving throw, gaining one level of {@condition exhaustion} on a failed save. At level 6, the creature becomes unconscious rather than dead. If the creature suffers another effect that causes {@condition exhaustion} while it is suffering level 6 {@condition exhaustion} from this action, the creature dies.
The {@creature swolbold|CCodex} loses its Crush action.

entries.name: New Feat
entries: The following feat is inspired by abilities possessed by a {@creature swolbold|CCodex}.

entries.name: New Magic Items and Spells
entries: The following magic item and spell are inspried by abilities possessed by a {@creature swolbold|CCodex}.

entries.name: Swolbold Adventure Hooks
entries: There are many adventures that can showcase a {@creature swolbold|CCodex}:

items: A {@creature swolbold|CCodex} enters a bar and challenges all patrons to unarmed combat. He offers 200 gp to anyone who can best him. In truth, the {@creature swolbold|CCodex} and others like him are locating competent fighters their kobold kin should incapacitate before an imminent kobold attack.

A group of {@creature swolbold|CCodex|swolbolds} wish to turn away from their bestial impulses and seek a more contemplative path. They have identified a monastery where they can theoretically study in peace and require an escort to reach the mountaintop location.

entries: Slightly larger than a housecat and sporting the wings of an owl, the leonine are beloved and rare pets in elvish courts and palaces, where they are kept as companion animals to royal children, courtesans, and gigolos...

entries.name: Alternate Traits and Actions
entries: The following changes allow GMs to alter a {@creature leonino|CCodex} without modifying its challenge rating.

entries.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., on target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage. The {@creature leonino|CCodex} grabs the target. If the target is a Tiny or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape DC 10). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}. A larger creature is not {@condition grappled}, and it can use an action to remove the {@creature leonino|CCodex} with a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check at the same DC. While the {@creature leonino|CCodex} has its target {@footnote grabbed|Probably means "{@condition grappled}".}, it deals 5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage with its rear claws.
This attack replaces the {@creature leonino|CCodex|leonino's} normal bite attack.

entries.name: Favored Messenger
entries: While the {@creature leonino|CCodex} is delivering a message, it has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
The {@creature leonino|CCodex} doesn't possess the Evasion trait.

entries.name: Resplendent Wings
entries: The {@creature leonino|CCodex|leonino's} wings are vibrantly colored, and it has advantage on Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) checks against creatures that can see its wings.
The {@creature leonino|CCodex} doesn't possess the Silent Wings trait.

entries.name: Rodentsense
entries: The {@creature leonino|CCodex} can detect the presence of rats and other rodents within 30 feet. This allows it to sense a shapeshifting creature that has at least one rodent-like form (such as a {@creature wererat}), even if the creature is not in that form. Additionally, the {@creature leonino|CCodex} has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to track rodents.
The {@creature leonino|CCodex} does not possess {@sense darkvision}.

entries.name: New Magic Item and Spells
entries: The following magic item and spells are inspired by a {@creature leonino|CCodex|leonino's} abilities.

entries.name: Leonino Adventure Hooks
entries: There are many adventures that can showcase a {@creature leonino|CCodex}:

items: A {@creature leonino|CCodex} has been hunting a particular {@creature wererat} for the past couple of months, but the {@creature wererat} has continuously thwarted its pursuit. Desperate for help, the {@creature leonino|CCodex} deigns to ask the PCs for assistance with its hunt. It has very little treasure to offer, but it promises to serve as a familiar to a PC after they have successfully dealt with the {@creature wererat}.

An elf offers a generous reward for the return of its {@creature leonino|CCodex} pet. While the elf reasons someone has kidnapped the {@creature leonino|CCodex}, the truth is the elf has been abusing the creature and it managed to escape.

entries: The small, skeletal dragon jumps down from the bookshelf where it was reading. It spreads its bony wings laced with brittle, leathery skin and exhales a cloud of choking dust that smells like an ancient tomb...

entries.name: Alternate Traits and Actions
entries: The following changes allow GMs to alter an {@creature unhatched|CCodex} without modifying its challenge rating.

entries.name: Draconic Hatred
entries: The {@creature unhatched|CCodex} harbors intense hatred for the draconic parent(s) that left it unprotected. The {@creature unhatched|CCodex} has advantage on attacks against dragons and creatures with a draconic heritage.
The {@creature unhatched|CCodex} loses its Hatred trait.

entries.name: Draconic Magic Resistance
entries: As a bonus action, the {@creature unhatched|CCodex} gives itself advantage on its next saving throw against spells or other magical effects originating from a dragon or creatures with a draconic heritage.
This trait replaces the {@creature unhatched|CCodex|unhatched's} Minor Magic Resistance trait.

entries.name: Dragon Breath
entries: The {@creature unhatched|CCodex} exhales elemental and necrotic infused breath based on the type of egg from which it was supposed to hatch. Each creature in the listed area must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking the listed damage plus 6 ({@damage 1d12}) necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A dragon or creature with a draconic heritage takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one:

items: {@b {@i Black or Copper:}} 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide, 11 ({@damage 2d10}) acid damage
{@b {@i Blue or Bronze:}} 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide, 11 ({@damage 2d10}) lightning damage
{@b {@i Red, Brass, or Gold:}} 30-foot cone, 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage
{@b {@i White or Silver:}} 30-foot cone, 11 ({@damage 2d10}) cold damage

entries: This trait replaces the {@creature unhatched|CCodex|unhatched's} Desiccating Breath trait.

entries.name: Horrifying Visage
entries: Each non-undead creature within 60 feet of the {@creature unhatched|CCodex} that can see it must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A dragon or creature with a draconic heritage has disadvantage on this saving throw. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns, ending the {@condition frightened} condition on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the {@creature unhatched|CCodex|unhatched's} Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours.
The {@creature unhatched|CCodex|unhatched's} Desiccating Breath action (or Dragon Breath action if that has replaced Desiccating Breath) recharges on {@dice 1d6|6}.

entries.name: Necromantic Familiar
entries: The {@creature unhatched|CCodex} acts as a familiar to a powerful undead creature. It can communicate with its master while it is within 100 feet of its master. As an action, the {@creature unhatched|CCodex|unhatched's} master can see through its eye and hear what it hears until the start of the master's next turn. The master gains the benefits of the {@creature unhatched|CCodex|unhatched's} {@sense darkvision}, but the master is deaf and blind with regard to the master's senses. The {@creature unhatched|CCodex} can deliver a spell its master casts with a range of touch as if it had cast the spell. It must be within 100 feet of its master, and it must use its reaction to deliver the spell when the master casts it. If the spell requires an attack roll, apply the master's attack modifier for the roll.
The {@creature unhatched|CCodex} loses its Hatred trait.

entries.name: Residual Immunities
entries: The {@creature unhatched|CCodex} retains the immunity inherent to the type of dragon it was meant to hatch as. Its immunity depends on the type of dragon egg:
If the {@creature unhatched|CCodex} is not from a green dragon egg, it loses its damage immunity to poison.

entries.name: New Magic Items and Spells
entries: The following magic items and spell are inspired by abilities possessed by an {@creature unhatched|CCodex}.

entries.name: Unhatched Adventure Hooks
entries: There are many adventures that can showcase an {@creature unhatched|CCodex}:

items: A kobold spirited away a red dragon egg and sold it to a necromancer. An envoy to one of the red dragon parents searches for capable adventurers to rescue the egg before the necromancer can transform the unborn dragon into an {@creature unhatched|CCodex}. The envoy promises riches from the dragon's hoard or perhaps more importantly a cessation of hostility by the red dragon for at least ten years as a reward. If the adventurers can find and capture or kill the thief, they receive additional rewards.

An archeological team discovered the entrance to a forgotten city belonging to an ancient civilization. A coterie of seven {@creature unhatched|CCodex} have claimed the city for themselves, so they can recover the civilization's arcane knowledge. The team requires a powerful group to remove the {@creature unhatched|CCodex}, so it can continue its exploration.

entries: This massive pale weasel moves with lightning speed. Its white fur is stained red with the crusty remains of its latest meal...

entries.name: Alternate Traits and Actions
entries: The following changes allow GMs to alter an {@creature albino death weasel|CCodex} without modifying its challenge rating.

entries.name: Albino Camouflage
entries: The {@creature albino death weasel|CCodex} is naturally camouflaged in areas with white backgrounds, such as snow-covered landscapes or against buildings painted white. While it is camouflaged in this way, it has advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks and can hide from creatures that can see it clearly.
The {@creature albino death weasel|CCodex} loses its proficiency bonus on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks.

entries.name: Blood Drain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft. one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) piercing damage. The target is also {@condition grappled} (escape DC 13) if it is a Medium or smaller creature and the albino weasel isn't already grappling a creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, the weasel can't bite another target, and at the start of each of the weasel's turns, the target loses 8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) hit points due to blood loss.
The {@creature albino death weasel|CCodex} loses its bite and claw attacks.

entries.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The {@creature albino death weasel|CCodex} has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.
The {@creature albino death weasel|CCodex} only has keen smell and no longer has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing.

entries.name: Swimming Death Weasel
entries: The {@creature albino death weasel|CCodex} was reared in a more aquatic environment. It gains a swim speed of 30 feet.
The {@creature albino death weasel|CCodex} loses its burrow speed.

entries.name: Weasel War Dance
entries: The {@creature albino death weasel|CCodex} makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claw. If the weasel reduces its walking speed to 40 feet, it has advantage on an attack against a creature if it moves at least 5 feet before attacking it. If it splits its attacks, it must move an additional 5 feet to gain advantage on the second attack.
The {@creature albino death weasel|CCodex} loses its pounce trait.

entries.name: New Feat
entries: The following feat is inspired by the {@creature albino death weasel|CCodex}.

entries.name: New magic Items and Spells
entries: The following magic item and spell are inspried by abilities possessed by an {@creature albino death weasel|CCodex}.

entries.name: Albino Death Weasel Ranger's Companion
entries: {@class ranger||Rangers} who don't mind the {@creature albino death weasel|CCOdex|albino death weasel's} voracious appetite have raised miniature versions of the animals to use as companion creatures.

entries.name: Albino Death Weasel Adventure Hooks
entries: There are many adventures that can showcase an {@creature albino death weasel|CCodex}:

items: Local farmers blame an {@creature ahuizotl|CCodex} for attacks on their livestock because they see evidence of the attacks leading to a nearby lake. They are afraid to confront the creature, so they call in the PCs.
