However, the creatures responsible for the deaths are a mated pair of {@creature albino death weasel|CCodex|albino death weasels}, rearing a litter of five kits.

A deranged druid is raising a half dozen {@creature albino death weasel|CCodex|albino death weasels} for their fur. While he waits to kill them, he treats them well to gain their trust and releases them regularly at night to feed.

entries: Commonly called a whale demon by sailors, the mane of bristles around the ziphius's face gives it an almost owl-like appearance as it cuts through the water with frightening speed...

entries.name: Alternate Traits and Actions
entries: The following changes allow GMs to alter a {@creature ziphius|CCodex} without modifying its challenge rating.

entries.name: Capsize
entries: If the {@creature ziphius|CCodex} moves at least 20 feet straight toward a seagoing vessel and then hits and damages it with a dorsal fin attack on the same turn, the vessel capsizes. A creature that can steer or otherwise control the vessel can prevent it from capsizing with a successful DC 16 Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check. If the craft is larger than the {@creature ziphius|CCodex}, the creature has advantage on this check, while a creature on a vessel smaller than the {@creature ziphius|CCodex} has disadvantage on this check.
The {@creature ziphius|CCodex} does not possess the Charge ability.

entries.name: Coastal Dweller
entries: The {@creature ziphius|CCodex|ziphius's} walking speed increases to 30 ft.

The {@creature ziphius|CCodex|ziphius's} swim speed is reduced to 40 ft. A coastal-dwelling {@creature ziphius|CCodex} is smaller than its deep-dwelling relatives, measuring no more than 45 feet long, but it retains its gargantuan size.

entries.name: Large Stomach
entries: The {@creature ziphius|CCodex} can have up to two targets swallowed at a time. When it takes 20 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the {@creature ziphius|CCodex} must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw for each creature it has swallowed at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the {@creature ziphius|CCodex}.
The reach for the {@creature ziphius|CCodex|ziphius's} Dorsal Fin attack is reduced to 5 ft.

entries.name: New Magic items and Spells
entries: The following magic item and spells are inspired by abilities possessed by the {@creature ziphius|CCodex}.

entries.name: Ziphius Adventure Hooks
entries: There are many adventures that can showcase a {@creature ziphius|CCodex}:

items: Reports of a {@creature ziphius|CCodex} attacking a major shipping lane inspire a generous reward for the creature's capture or demise. However, {@creature sahuagin} have been staging these attacks to entice others to kill the {@creature ziphius|CCodex}, which has claimed territory desired by the {@creature sahuagin}.

An injured {@creature ziphius|CCodex} washes up on shore and telepathically pleas for help dispatching a {@creature devil shark|CCodex}). If the PCs successfully defeat the shark, the {@creature ziphius|CCodex} gifts them with jewels from its sunken city.

items.name: Frosty Vengeance
entries: When a frostbitten scion takes cold damage, it has advantage on its attack rolls until the end of its next turn. If it takes more than 5 cold damage, it has advantage on its attack rolls for 2 rounds.

items.name: Wintersight
entries: A frostbitten scion can see through areas obscured by ice, snow, and fog without penalty.

items.name: Stinging Ice {@recharge}
entries: The frostbitten scion fills the area with a cloud of ice shards. Each creature within 10 feet of the frostbitten scion must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) cold damage and 14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. The ice melts within moments.
A frostbitten scion has similar origins to a {@creature flame-scourged scion|CCodex}, except those who destroyed its grove used powerful cold magic.

{@class ranger||Rangers} who don't mind the {@creature albino death weasel|CCOdex|albino death weasel's} voracious appetite have raised miniature versions of the animals to use as companion creatures.

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: The companion albino death weasel has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the weasel moves at least 20 feet straight towards a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the creature can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Musk Spray (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The weasel unleashes a spray of foul musk in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

feat.name: Crusher
entries: You've learned how to crush the bones of foes you grapple, gaining the following benefits:

items: Your unarmed strike uses a {@damage d4} for damage.

You can use your action to force a creature {@condition grappled} by you to make a Strength saving throw. The saving throw DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier. On a failed save, you deal bludgeoning damage to the creature equal to twice the damage dealt by your unarmed strike.

feat.name: Weasel War Dancer
entries: Confounding opponents with your erratic movements, you gain the following benefits:

items: When you use the {@action Dash} action, all creatures that can see you have disadvantage on their attack rolls against you until the beginning of your next turn.
By reducing your speed by 10 feet, you gain advantage on an attack made after moving at least 5 feet.

item.name: Arcanaphage Stone
entries: This smooth rock serves a similar function as rocks found in a bird's gizzard and helps the {@creature arcanaphage|CCodex} digest magic. While you hold or wear the stone, you have advantage on saving throws against spells.

Additionally, you can use a reaction to counter a spell cast within 30 feet of you as if you cast {@spell counterspell}. Unlike the spell, you must always make a spellcasting ability check (using Charisma as your spellcasting ability if you do not have one), no matter the spell level. If you successfully counter the spell, the stone increases its Absorption score by 1. Its Absorption score cannot exceed 8. Once you have used the stone to counter a spell, it can't be used in this way until the next dawn.

Finally, you can use an action to throw the stone up to 60 feet away to unleash its stored magic. When it reaches its target, it explodes, and each creature within 5 feet per Absorption score must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 1d6} force damage per Absorption score on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This destroys the stone.

item.name: Bookkeeper Inkpot
entries: This glass vessel looks like an ordinary inkpot. A quill fashioned from an ostrich feather accompanies the inkpot. You can use the vessel to contain a {@creature bookkeeper|CCodex}. A willing {@creature bookkeeper|CCodex} moves to the inkpot, but an unwilling specimen must succeed on a DC 13 Charisma saving throw or be transferred to the inkpot, making you the {@creature bookkeeper|CCodex|bookkeeper's} new "creator." While the {@creature bookkeeper|CCodex} is contained within the vessel, it suffers no harm due to being away from its bound book, but it cannot use any of its abilities that apply to it being in a bound book. Dipping the quill in the inkpot and writing in a book binds the {@creature bookkeeper|CCodex} to the new book.
If the inkpot is found as treasure, there is a {@chance 50|50%} chance it contains a {@creature bookkeeper|CCodex}. Variant inkpots work for {@creature inkling|CCodex|inklings}.

item.name: Recording Book
entries: This book, which hosts a dormant {@creature bookkeeper|CCodex}, appears to be a journal filled with empty pages. You can place the book anywhere and use an action to speak its command word and activate it. It remains activated until you use an action to speak the command word again.

The {@creature bookkeeper|CCodex} records all things said within 60 feet of it. It can distinguish voices and notes those as it records. The book holds up to 12 hours' worth of conversation. Any creature, other than you or targets you designate, that peruses the book finds the pages blank.

item.name: Devil Shark Mask
entries: When you wear this burgundy face covering, it transforms your face into a shark-like visage, and the mask sprouts wicked horns. You gain a bite attack that deals {@damage 1d8} piercing damage and that counts as a magic weapon. You also gain a +1 bonus on attack and damage rolls made with your bite attack.
Additionally, you have advantage on Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) checks while wearing this mask.

entries.name: Curse
entries: The mask is cursed, and becoming attuned to it extends the curse to you. As long as you remain cursed, you are unwilling to part with the mask, wearing it at all times. If you haven't used the mask to bite a living creature before dusk, you tear out a chunk of your flesh. You take {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage and your hp maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the curse is removed. If your hp maximum is reduced to 0 as a result of this curse, you die, transform into a {@creature devil shark|CCodex}, and teleport to the nearest open body of water.

item.name: Frost Pellet
entries: Fashioned from a devil shark's stomach lining, this rubbery pill is cold to the touch. Upon swallowing the pellet, which leaves you feeling bloated, you gain immunity to cold damage. Up to 1 hour after swallowing the pellet, you can expel a 30-foot cone of cold water. Each creature in the cone must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 8d6} cold damage and is pushed 10 feet away from you. On a success, the target takes half the damage and isn't pushed away.

item.name: Moon Drake Dagger
entries: This dagger is fashioned from a {@creature moon drake|CCodex|moon drake's} fang. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

You can use an action to imbue this weapon with additional magic for 1 minute or until an attack using this weapon hits a shapeshifter. That creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 2d10} radiant damage. On a failed save, the shapeshifter instantly reverts to its true form and can't assume a different form for {@dice 1d4} rounds. The dagger can't be used this way again until the next sunset.

item.name: Pact Drake Contract Paper
entries: This smooth paper is like vellum but is prepared from dozens of scales cast off by a {@creature pact drake|CCodex}. A contract can be inked on this paper, and the paper limns all falsehoods on it with {@spell faerie fire}. A command word clears the paper, allowing for several drafts. Another command word locks the contract in place and leaves space for signatures. Creatures signing the contract are afterward bound by the contract with all other signatories alerted when a creature breaks the contract. The creature breaking the contract must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or become {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, and {@condition stunned} for {@dice 1d6} minutes. A creature can attempt a new saving throw at the end of each of minute, ending the conditions with a success. After the conditions end, the creature has disadvantage on saving throws until it finishes a long rest.

item.name: Periapt of Proof Against Lies
entries: A pendant fashioned from a {@creature pact drake|CCodex} claw or part of a {@creature pact drake|CCodex} horn is affixed to a thin gold chain. While you wear it, you automatically sense if you hear a lie, but this does not apply to evasions that remain within the boundaries of the truth.
Until you finish a long rest after wearing the periapt, you gain the {@condition poisoned} condition for 10 minutes if you lie.

item.name: Venomous Fangs
entries: If you do not already have a bite attack, these fangs allow you to use an action to attack a target with a bite that deals piercing damage with a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls and a damage die of {@damage 1d4}.

While you wear the fangs, a successful DC 9 Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) checks conceals them from view. At the GM's discretion, you have disadvantage on Charisma ({@skill Deception} or {@skill Persuasion}) checks against creatures that notice the fangs.

You can use an action to cause the fangs to fill with a green poison. The poison remains active for 1 minute or until you hit a creature with a bite attack. That creature must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d10} poison damage and become {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn. The fangs can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

item.name: Goggles of Firesight
entries: The lenses of these combination fleshy and plantlike goggles extend a few inches away from the goggles on a pair of tentacles. While wearing these lenses, you can see through areas obscured by fire, smoke, and fog without penalty.

As a reaction when you are the target of an effect that blinds you, you can force the goggles to intercept the effect, giving you immunity to it. If you do so, you cannot use any of the goggle's functions until the next dawn.

item.name: Vengeful Coat
entries: This stiff, vaguely uncomfortable coat covers your torso. It smells like ash and oozes a sap-like substance. While wearing this coat, you are resistant to slashing damage from nonmagical attacks.

At dawn, you can choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. If you take damage matching the chosen type, you have advantage on your attack rolls until the end of your next turn. If you take more than 10 damage matching the chosen type, you have advantage on your attack rolls for 2 rounds.

As a reaction when you are the target of an effect that inflicts damage of the chosen type, you can gain resistance to that damage. The coat grants you advantage on your attack rolls as above and then becomes nonfunctional until the next dawn.

item.name: Fulminar Bracers
entries: Stylized etchings of {@creature fulminar|CCodex|fulminars} cover the outer surfaces of these solid silver bracers. Lightning crackles harmlessly down your hands while you wear them. Additionally, while wearing the bracers, you have resistance to lightning and thunder damage.

The bracers have 3 charges. You can expend 1 charge as an action to create two sets of lightning shackles, each of which strike a creature you can see within 60 feet. A target must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) lightning damage and is {@condition restrained} for 1 minute. On a success, the target takes half the damage but isn't {@condition restrained}. A {@condition restrained} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. The bracers regain all expended charges daily at dawn and can regain a single charge if you take at least 10 lightning damage while wearing them.

item.name: Ghost Dragon Horn
entries: Scales from dead dragons cover this wooden, curved horn. You can use an action to speak the horn's command word and then blow the horn, which emits a blast in a 30-foot cone, containing shrieking incorporeal dragon heads. Each creature in the cone must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature tales {@damage 8d10} psychic damage and is {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@footnote {@condition deafened}|Perhaps meant to be "{@condition frightened}"?}. Dragons have disadvantage on the saving throw and take {@damage 16d10} psychic damage instead of {@damage 8d10}. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
If the horn's magic targets a dragon, it has a {@chance 20|20%} chance of causing the horn to explode. The explosion deals {@damage 16d10} psychic damage to the blower and destroys the horn.
Once you use the horn, you can't use it again until the next dawn. You can also regain the use of the horn after you kill a dragon and complete a short or long rest.

item.name: Mantle of the Void
entries: While wearing this midnight-blue cloth covered in writhing runes, you gain a +1 bonus to saving throws. If you succeed on a saving throw against an enemy spell while wearing the mantle, you don't suffer the spell's effects. Additionally, as a bonus action on your next turn, you can infuse your next spell or melee attack with power from the Void. One creature that is hit by a spell you cast or that fails a saving throw against that spell, or one creature you successfully hit with a melee weapon attack, is {@condition stunned} until the end of the creature's next turn.

If you successfully hit a target with the slam attack granted by the wraps and the target is no more than one size larger than you, you can use a bonus action to automatically grapple the target. Once you have used this bonus action three times, the bonus action can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Gloomflower Corsage
entries: This black, six-petaled flower fits neatly on a garment's lapel or peeking out of a pocket. You gain advantage on saving throws against effects that inflict the {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, or {@condition frightened} conditions while wearing it.
As an action, you can invoke the corsage's power, which causes one of the petals to curl in on itself. If no petals are available, you can no longer use this item. Choose from the following effects:

items: Make a ranged spell attack with a {@hit +6} bonus against any target within 120 ft. On a successful hit, the target takes {@damage 3d6} psychic damage.

Creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls against you for 1 minute. An attacker is immune to this effect if it doesn't rely on sight, as with {@sense blindsight}, or can see through illusions, as with {@sense truesight}.

entries: Daily at dusk, {@damage 1d6} petals return to normal.

item.name: Hallucinatory Dust
entries: This small packet contains black {@creature gloomflower|CCodex} pollen around which swirl hazy images. There is enough of it for one use. When you use an action to blow the dust, each creature in a 30-foot cone must make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature sees terrible visions, manifesting its fears and anxieties for 1 minute. While affected, it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage at the start of each of its turns and must spend its action to make one melee attack against a creature within 5 feet of it, other than you or itself. If the creature can't make a melee attack, it takes the {@action Dodge} action. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a success, a creature becomes {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn as the visions fade but is otherwise unaffected.

A creature reduced to 0 hp by the dust's psychic damage falls {@condition unconscious} and is stable. When the creature regains consciousness, it is permanently plagued by hallucinations and has disadvantage on ability checks until cured by a {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic.

item.name: Gauntlet of the Iron Sphere
entries: This heavy gauntlet, adorned with an onyx, seems to crush your hand when you wear it. Unarmed strikes with your gauntleted hand become magic weapons that deal bludgeoning damage with a +1 bonus to attack rolls and a damage die of {@damage 1d8}. Your unarmed strikes deal double damage to objects and structures.

If you hold a pound of raw iron ore in the gauntlet, you can use an action to speak the gauntlet's command word and summon an {@creature iron sphere|CCodex} as if you had cast the {@spell conjure iron sphere|ExpCCodex} spell. The gauntlet can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

item.name: SwolBold Wraps
entries: When wearing these cloth wraps, your forearms and hands swell to half again their normal size without negatively impacting your fine motor skills. The wraps allow you to use an action to attack a target with a slam that deals bludgeoning damage, with a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls and a damage die of {@damage 1d4}.

If you successfully hit a target with the slam attack granted by the wraps and the target is no more than one size larger than you, you can use a bonus action to automatically grapple the target. Once you have used this bonus action three times, the bonus action can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Leonino Wings
entries: This cloak works similarly to {@item wings of flying}, but using an action to speak its command word transforms the cloak into a pair of {@creature leonino|CCodex} wings. The wings give you a flying speed of 50 feet, and you have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made while flying in forests and urban settings. Additionally, when you fly out of an enemy's reach, you don't provoke {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}.

item.name: Dust of Desiccation
entries: This small packet contains soot-like dust. There is enough of it for one use. When you use an action to blow the choking dust from your palm, all creatures in a 30-foot cone must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 16 ({@damage 3d10}) necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails this save can't speak until the end of its next turn.
Alternatively, you can use an action to throw the dust into the air, affecting yourself and all creatures within 30 feet of you with the dust.

item.name: Staff of the Unhatched
item.reqAttune: by a sorcerer, warlock, or wizard
entries: This staff carved from a burnt ash tree is topped with an {@creature unhatched|CCodex|unhatched's} skull. The staff has 10 charges. It can be wielded as a magic {@item quarterstaff|PHB}. When you hit with a melee attack using it, you can expend 1 charge, and the target takes an extra {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage.

While holding the staff, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC: {@spell bane} (2 charges), {@spell chill touch} (1 charge), or {@spell minor illusion} (1 charge).
The staff regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dusk. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the staff crumbles to dust and is destroyed.

item.name: Boots of Pouncing
entries: While you wear these boots with an {@creature albino death weasel|CCodex} fur collar, your walking speed becomes 40 feet, unless your walking speed is higher. Your speed is still reduced if you are encumbered or wearing heavy armor.

If you move at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and hit it with a melee weapon attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, you can make a melee weapon attack against it as a bonus action.

item.name: Helm of the Slashing Fin
entries: While wearing this helm, you can speak its command word as an action to gain the ability to breathe underwater, but you lose the ability to breathe air. You can speak its command word again or remove the cap as an action to reverse this effect.

You can use the attack action to make an attack with the fin topping the helm, which deals damage as a {@item greataxe|PHB|great axe}. You are proficient with the slashing fin. If you move at least 20 feet straight toward a target and hit it with the fin on the same turn, the hit is a critical hit.

item.name: Ziphian Eye Amulet
entries: This gold amulet holds a preserved eye from a {@creature ziphius|CCodex}. It has 3 charges. As a bonus action, you can speak its command word, which expends 1 charge, and choose one creature within 60 feet that you can see. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or you create a temporary mental bond with the target until the start of your next turn. You can choose to gain advantage on attacks against the target or cause the target to have disadvantage on attacks against you. The amulet regains all expended charges daily at dawn.
